identificationModule.briefTitle: Left Atrial Appendage Closure With the LAmbre
identificationModule.officialTitle: Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Closure Using the LAmbre Device in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation: a Single-center, Retrospective, Long-term Real-world Study

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Director, Head of Cardiology, Principal Investigator

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study was to retrospectively analyse the efficacy and safety of LAA closure using the LAmbre in our center from April 2014 to November 2015.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study was to retrospectively analyse the efficacy and safety of percutaneous left atrial appendage (LAA) closure using the LAmbre (Lifetech Scientific Co., Ltd., Shenzhen, China) in our center from April 2014 to November 2015. 89.4% has finished the 12-month esophageal ecllocardiogrhy (TEE) examination. The average followup was 2-years.

armGroups.label: LAA closure with LAmbre
armGroups.description: The patients with atrial fibrillation who received left atrial appendage (LAA) closure using the LAmbre device in our center from April 2014 to November 2015.

interventions.name: LAA closure with LAmbre
interventions.description: Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Closure Using the LAmbre Device in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The composite safety and efficacy end-points
secondaryOutcomes.description: all-cause death, stroke, major bleeding, thromboembolism, device related severe complications
successful sealing around the device at the LAA orifice (residual jet flow of \< 5 mm) as measured by transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) at 6 months after device implantation

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The aim of this retrospective study was to evaluate the long-term follow-up results associated with left atrial appendage closure (LAAC) with the LAmbre (Lifetech Scientific Corp., Shenzhen, China) in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF).
